intro: Clypeola chaetocarpa, commonly known as the hairy-fruited clypeola, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, and its fruit is a dry, hairy capsule. Clypeola chaetocarpa is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a perennial herb that grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters.
